summary: The document is an interview schedule and summary from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) regarding an interview with Sgt. Lewis Wesley Leber, conducted on February 24, 1978, at Langley AFB, VA. The interview aimed to gather information about Captain William C. Stanley, a former Special Security Officer for Headquarters TAC-Intelligence, and his potential connections or knowledge related to the JFK assassination. It details the interview's circumstances, including the presence and subsequent departure of military observers to facilitate a more open discussion. Key points include Sgt. Leber's recollection of Captain Stanley's service, financial problems, and his departure from the military to study law, as well as mentions of other servicemen associated with Captain Stanley whose whereabouts were unknown at the time.
key_findings: Sgt. Leber recalled Captain William C. Stanley's role as a Special Security Officer and his service under Major Rudolph Gobel.
No recollection of conversations with Captain Stanley about the JFK assassination, Russia, Cuba, or Mexico.
Captain Stanley faced severe financial problems and was possibly 'r.i.f.'ed' from the service in 1971, later studying law at the University of Miami.
Two servicemen under Captain Stanley, Larry F. Caison and Chief Master Sergeant Charles Fischer, were identified for further information, but their whereabouts were unknown.
